_header: Feasts moveable there beth cleped five in the year
_description: Septuagesima in the South English Legendary — in couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
FEsten meble þer beþ icleped viue in þe
                    ȝereþe uerste is to louke aleluye our penaunce to rere
                    …
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…þat we scholde wiþ sorwe of herte our penaunce
                    lede& aȝen þe tyme of leynte repenty our mysdede

Bod779.First Lines:
Festen moble þat beþ I cleped fyue in þe
                    ȝereþe ferste is to loke aleluia oure penaunce to
                    rere…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…þat we cholde wit sorwe of herte oure penaunce here
                    lede& aȝen þe tyme of lente repenty oure mysdede
Bod779.Note:
Second occurrence of 5334 and only one of 3048 in this MS is treated as part of this
                    text.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
FEstes meble þer beþ i cleped fyue in þe
                    ȝereÞe furste is to louke Alleluya vre penaunce to
                    arere…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Septuagesime is icleped whon me loukeþ Alleluyeffor we
                    schulle bi ginne bi fore vr lord vr herte to abuye
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
FEstes meuable þer beo cleped fiue in þe ȝereÞe
                    first is louke alleluye Oure penance forto rere…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Þat we sholle with sorwe of herte repente oure
                    misdede& aȝeyn þe time of leinte repente oure
                    misdede
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line

BodTan17.First Lines:
Festis meueable þer be clepid fyue in þe ȝereÞe
                    firste is to louke alleluya oure lente to arere…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…Þat we schulde wiþ sorwe of herte oure penaunce
                    ledeAȝen þe tyme of lente repente of oure mysdede

OxfTri57.First Lines:
Festen meuable buþ y clepud fyue in þe ȝereÞe
                    ferste ys to louke alleluye oure penaunce to rere…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…Þat we scholle with sorwe of herte oure penance ledeAnd
                    aȝe þe tyme of Leynte repenty oure mysdede

CULFf548.First Lines:
Festes þat fallis in þe ȝere þat we calle
                    stirerandeÞe first men cloises alleluya as i
                    understonde…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…Þat we shuld with soro of hert oure life in penaunce
                    ledeAnd at ourre pouere to make amendys to god for oure mysdede
CULFf548.Editions:
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 230.

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Festen mouable þer beoþ icluped viue in þe
                    ȝereþe veorste is to louke alleluye oure leinte to
                    rere…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Þat we ssolleþ wiþ sorwe of heorte oure penance
                    ledeAnd aȝen þe time of leinte repenty oure misdede
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 128.

CamKC13.First Lines:
Festes moouables þer beþ i clepid fyue in þe
                    ȝereÞe firste is to louke alleluya oure leynte for to
                    rere…
CamKC13.Last Lines:
…And þat we schullen wiþ sorwe of herte oure penaunce
                    ledeAnd aȝen þe tyme of leynte repenti oure misdede

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Festes Meouables þer beoþ ycluped ffyue in þe
                    ȝereÞe ffurste is to louke Alleluya oure leynte ffor to
                    arere…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…And þat we shulleþ wiþ sorwe of heorte oure
                    penaunce ledeAnd aȝen Pe tyme of leynte repenty of oure
                    mysdede

CamStJohn28.First Lines:
Festes þer ben cleped fyue in þe ȝereþe ferste
                    is to close alleluia oure penaunce to a rere…
CamStJohn28.Last Lines:
…þat we schul with sorwe oure penaunce here ledeand a
                    ȝen þe tyme of lentun repente oure mysdede

CamTCC605.First Lines:
Festes moble þer beþ cleped fyue in þe
                    ȝereþe furste is to louken alleluia oure penauns to
                    rere…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…þat we schulle with sorow of hert oure penauns lede&
                    aȝen þe tyme of lente repente of oure mysdede
CamTCC605.Note: On verso of unnumbered folio after f. 52

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
FEsten meuable þer beþ y cluped vyue in þe
                    ȝereþe verste is to luke aleluye oure lente to
                    rere…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…Þat we ssolle wiþ sorue of hert oure penance
                    ledeAnd aȝen þe tyme of leinte repenty oure mys dede
BLAdd10301.Attributed Title:
De septuagesima (f. 59, by scribe in margin beside first
                    line)

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: FEsten meble þer beþ iclepit vif in þe ȝereþe ferste is to louke alleluy our penaunce to rere…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þat we scholle with sorwe of herte oure penaunce lede& aȝen þe time of lente repenti our misdede
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xxvi” added to right margin by later hand (f. 52).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Festes meble þer beþ cleped viue in þe ȝereÞe furste is to louke alleluia oure penaunce to rere…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …God vs lete oure sunnes beie ar we henne wendeÞat we mote in heuene wone euere wiþ outen ende
BLEge1993.Note:
Not listed in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943 or Boffey  and  Edwards (2005)
XJulia Boffey,   and  A. S. G. Edwards.  
             A New Index of Middle English Verse.
         London: The British Library, 2005; ends, ‘Amen’ (f. 131v).

BLEge2810.First Lines: …Septuagesime is ycluped wan me locþ alleluyevor we ssolde byginne vr herte to to vr louerde buye…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …þat we ssold wiþ sorwe of herte vr penaunce lede& aȝein þe time of leynte repenty vr misdede

BLHar2277.First Lines: FEstes mouables þer beoþ icliped fiue in þe ȝereÞe furste is to loke alleluya oure penance to rere…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …þat we schulle wiþ sarwe of hurte oure penance lede& aȝe þe tyme of leynte repenti of oure misdede

Lam223.First Lines:
FEstes meuable þer ben cleped five in þe ȝerÞe
                    first is to loke Allaluy our penaunce to arer…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Þe first is called spetuagesme when men lowken þe
                    Alleluyffor we shul begynne bifore our lord our hert forto bowe

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Feestis meueable þer be .v. in þe ȝereÞe furst
                    men louketh alleluia our penaunce to rere…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Þat we shul wiþ sorowe of hert our penaunce so
                    ledeAnd aȝene þe tyme of lente repent our mysdede
